item.title: Memorial Mathematics Working Seminar
item.description:
Fall Schedule: 2â€“3 pm in HH 3013

September 30th Christopher Lang - An introduction to topological recursion
Topological recursion is a construction in algebraic geometry that recursively computes invariants of spectral curves. It has applications to enumerative geometry, string theory, knot theory, mathematical physics, and random matrix theory, among others. I will introduce some of the main concepts of this construction.
